website_summaries.verdict: Vita-Sand is an excellent substrate for desert dwelling lizards and tortoises, promotes burrowing behavior, and provides some additional health benefits if granules are consumed here and there.
pros: Available in Gobi Gold and Outback Orange colors
Fortified with vitamins, calcium, and beta carotene
cons: It would be convenient if Vita-Sand was available in sizes larger or smaller than 10 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Danger to Leopard Geckos
customer_reviews.text: The sand was a terrible purchase for my leopard geckos. The sand is dangerous and can lead to impaction with excess indigestion especially if the gecko is low on calcium so they will start eating the sand, and it is impossible to clean out of their enclosure once you realize how harmful it is.
customer_reviews.author: lucia l.

customer_reviews.title: Like reallllly dusty
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a substrate for a bearded dragon do not buy this junk. I ignored reviews that i saw. This stuff is dusty. Like reallllly dusty. I didnt want to hold my dragon because it would leave crap all over my clothes. Also this stuff stinks. The smell is bad im not going to lie. Waste of 50 bucks. Use ceramic tile instead.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR BEARDED DRAGONS (all ages)
customer_reviews.text: Killed my bearded dragon of 6 years. :( First time using this sand. I made sure there was none on the side where her food and water was. Still ingested it . She died only a week or two after putting it in her tank. Do not recommend for any sized bearded dragon.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Sand is too much of a pain.
customer_reviews.text: I got this sand for my leopard gecko. It's really dusty and more yellow than the other vita-sand I had gotten, which I assumed was the same as this. Sand is terrible for lizard owners who feed their pets crickets. The crickets will dirty up the sand really quickly. I decided enough was enough and switched to tile, and now my leopard gecko is super happy. I won't be using sand ever again, too much to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Flower

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was sketchy but gave us a laugh because I was expecting an Amazon box and it was a large envelope and it felt cold and meaty... which sounds weird but it gave us a scare/laugh. Love it! My gecko does too!!
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell17

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest mess
customer_reviews.text: Used for awhile with Bearded dragon but difficult to keep than sand more cleaner with cricket fecies so it can make everything sick
customer_reviews.author: Stana Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Its sand
customer_reviews.text: Its a bag of sand. I haven't tasted it and my beardie is doing excellent. I poured it into the aquarium and it sits at the bottom just like sand. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Same as in pet stores but MUCH cheaper. I love this brand and love having it appear at my door!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sand for snake enclosures.
customer_reviews.text: Good sand for my son's constrictor enclosures. Helps make clean up easier because it clumps around the waste nicely so we can get in & out quickly without annoying some of the crankier snakes.
customer_reviews.author: Miss E

customer_reviews.title: Good sand
customer_reviews.text: My lizard loves this sand! It looks good in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this sand for my bearded dragon!! Just wish there was a bigger bag of it and not such a small bag.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M

customer_reviews.title: Has a slight smell, but makes cleaning up after ...
customer_reviews.text: Has a slight smell, but makes cleaning up after my bearded dragon much easier. He also enjoys digging in it, upgraded from reptile carpet.
customer_reviews.author: samantha780

customer_reviews.title: Molds quickly
customer_reviews.text: Ive had to throw almost half away because it keeps growing mold
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This stuff isn't great. Perhaps if you have a pet prone to ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff isn't great. Perhaps if you have a pet prone to eating the sand it would be useful but besides that it is more trouble than its worth. It's chalky and messy. If you have an average sized lizard you'll throw the majority of the sand away as it clumps together. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cristhian Varela

customer_reviews.title: Bag ripped
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy, the package was ripped and half of it was gone, so only really got a 5lb bag!!
customer_reviews.author: Aleaha brace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Beardie loves this mixed with Vita sand and reptifresh.
customer_reviews.author: Brent A. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Yep it's gold sand
customer_reviews.text: Yep, it's a nicely colored sand. Fine quality, no dust. Our lizards seem to like moving it around and tunneling. So, does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: KJS

customer_reviews.title: Good medium for the bottom of my dragon tanks
customer_reviews.text: Good medium for the bottom of my dragon tanks...haven't had an issue with compaction yet and the dragons love digging in it!
customer_reviews.author: TJ C.

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: When we got the bag there was a hole in it and sane had spilled out.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This sand is super great! Very soft and not an odd smell to it at all. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in my living room, is good for the leopard gecko
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: Fine Grain sand :)
customer_reviews.text: Its really realy dusty but its great sand other than that Nice and fine
customer_reviews.author: Jezreel-Ann

customer_reviews.title: It's NOT sand
customer_reviews.text: This is not sand, it's calcium carbonite. The product name is deceptive. It's the consistency of drink mix powder and it has an odd smell that pervades the entire room the product is in. But the worst is that it seems to attract lizards to eat it--maybe because of the smell or the super fine dusty powderness, I don't know. But I can't have my lizards eating calcium carbonite instead of food.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B

customer_reviews.title: Great color!
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than trying to buy in the pet store. Very nice color for my son's leopard geckos. Easy to scoop up and clean out.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine in a leopard gecko terrarium. I've seen my gecko eat this stuff with no apparent I'll effects.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Solid and safe product at a great value.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my dragon, and is easy to scoop out feces because it clumps a bit. Will get kind of hard because of this if you spill a lot of water. Has a vitamin c smell to it when it heats up but not totally offensive and helps to cover some of the regular smell of the animal. For the guy who had an impacted lizard because of this, this sand is much safer than any other loose substrate, and is recommended by both my vet and the manager of my local pet store, as well as most good bearded dragon boards. DO NOT USE ANY LOOSE SUBSTRATE WITH DRAGONS YOUNGER THAN 6 MONTHS. They will become impacted.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious with bearded dragons....
customer_reviews.text: This sand is good and clean, very pleasing to the eye. It feels good in the hand and does not smell weird. However, this is only suitable for bearded dragons that are adults and do not eat substrate. If your beardie has a tendency to eat substrate along with food, this will probably give him impactions since it will interfere with digestion by neutralizing stomach acid.
customer_reviews.author: Legit Jerome

product_meta.title: Zoo Med Vita-Sand in Gobi Gold
product_meta.description: Size:10 LBSAll Natural Vitamin-Fortified Calcium Carbonate Substrate . No artificial colors or color sealers. Excellent substrate for bearded dragons, uromastyx lizards, monitors, geckos (including leopard geckos), and desert tortoises. Increases calcium delivery in all desert species of reptiles. Fortified with vitamins and beta carotene for increased health benefits. Does not contain fat-soluble vitamins which can be toxic in large doses. Ultra fine grade to help prevent against impaction from over consumption.
